keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Brussels, and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Aurelien Breeden, Lilia Blaise and Milan Schreuer from Paris; Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London; and Russell Goldman from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Abdeslam had evaded the authorities for four months; his fingerprint was found in a residence raided by the police this week.

headline.print_headline: Belgians Arrest Fugitive Suspect in Paris Attacks
headline.main: Salah Abdeslam, Suspect in Paris Attacks, Is Captured in Brussels

snippet: Mr. Abdeslam had evaded the authorities for four months; his fingerprint was found in a residence raided by the police this week.
abstract: Belgian authorities capture Salah Abdeslam, believed to be only survivor of group involved in Paris attacks; prosecutors say fingerprint led them to Abdeslam in Molenbeek, Belgium, and could give intelligence agencies more information about his ties to Islamic State and how attacks were planned and carried out.
